        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<span class="line"><!---->UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Monterey <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Monterey <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<span class="line"><!---->1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<!----></span><br>2. run the command:<span class="line"><!---->2. run the command:<!----></span><br>asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <span class="line"><!---->asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <!----></span>http://localhost/winclose.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/winclose.html"><!---->http://localhost/winclose.html<!----></a><br>3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL           <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

        }

        }

        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 100;
        }

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<span class="line"><!---->UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Monterey <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Monterey <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<span class="line"><!---->1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<!----></span><br>2. run the command:<span class="line"><!---->2. run the command:<!----></span><br>asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <span class="line"><!---->asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <!----></span>http://localhost/winclose.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/winclose.html"><!---->http://localhost/winclose.html<!----></a><br>3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [browser]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash:           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 4, 2022, 8:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        <div>

        This looks like a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->This looks like a duplicate of <!----></span>Issue 1344756<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1344756" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in ReadAnythingCoordinator::CreateAndRegisterEntry"><!---->Issue 1344756<!----></a>; marking it as such. When the browser window closed, both the<span class="line"><!---->This was causing a UAF. When the ScopedObservation attempted to remove observer,<span class="line"><!---->respectively. When the ScopedObservation attempted to remove observer,<!----></span><br>the pointer had already been freed. This change adds<span class="line"><!---->the pointer had already been freed. This change adds<!----></span><br>ReadAnythingCoordinator as an observer to SidePanelEntry and removes<span class="line"><!---->ReadAnythingCoordinator as an observer to SidePanelEntry and removes<!----></span><br>it as an observer via deregistering it from SidePanelRegistry.<span class="line"><!---->it as an observer via deregistering it from SidePanelRegistry.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1266555<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1266555<!----></span>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1344756<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <div id="message"><!---->
          <b>Note:</b>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<span class="line"><!---->UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Monterey <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Monterey <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<span class="line"><!---->1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<!----></span><br>2. run the command:<span class="line"><!---->2. run the command:<!----></span><br>asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <span class="line"><!---->asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <!----></span>http://localhost/winclose.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/winclose.html"><!---->http://localhost/winclose.html<!----></a><br>3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [browser]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [browser]<!----></span><br><br>Asan log:<span class="line"><!---->Asan log:<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 4, 2022, 8:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

When the browser window closed, both the<span class="line"><!---->This was causing a UAF. When the browser window closed, both the<!----></span><br>SidePanelEntry and the ReadAnythingCoordinator were destroyed at the<span class="line"><!---->SidePanelEntry and the ReadAnythingCoordinator were destroyed at the<!----></span><br>same time as they are SupportsUserData and BrowserUserData,<span class="line"><!---->same time as they are SupportsUserData and BrowserUserData,<!----></span><br>respectively. When the ScopedObservation attempted to remove observer,<span class="line"><!---->respectively. When the ScopedObservation attempted to remove observer,<!----></span><br>the pointer had already been freed. This change adds<span class="line"><!---->the pointer had already been freed. This change adds<!----></span><br>ReadAnythingCoordinator as an observer to SidePanelEntry and removes<span class="line"><!---->ReadAnythingCoordinator as an observer to SidePanelEntry and removes<!----></span><br>it as an observer via deregistering it from SidePanelRegistry.<span class="line"><!---->it as an observer via deregistering it from SidePanelRegistry.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1266555<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1266555<!----></span>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1344756<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"             Issue 1349795: Security:UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() (browser process)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1349795: Security:UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() (browser process)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      0xasn...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2297871127" title="0xasn...@gmail.com"><!---->0xasn...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      0xasn...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->0xasn...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Aug 3, 2022, 10:45 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 3, 2022, 10:45 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 3, 2022, 10:45 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1349795: Security:UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() (browser process)
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 3, 2022, 10:45 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<span class="line"><!---->UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Monterey <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Monterey <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<span class="line"><!---->1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<!----></span><br>2. run the command:<span class="line"><!---->2. run the command:<!----></span><br>asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <span class="line"><!---->asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL         by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 4, 2022, 8:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 4<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<span class="line"><!---->UAF in ReadAnythingCoordinator::~ReadAnythingCoordinator() in the browser process<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 106.0.5215.0 (Developer Build)  (arm64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Monterey <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Monterey <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<span class="line"><!---->1. put the winclose.html into the webserver dir.<!----></span><br>2. run the command:<span class="line"><!---->2. run the command:<!----></span><br>asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <span class="line"><!---->asan_build/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium" --user-data-dir=/tmp/any --enable-features=ReadAnything  <!----></span>http://localhost/winclose.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/winclose.html"><!---->http://localhost/winclose.html<!----></a><br>3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->3. when the close the chromium ,the UAF will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [browser]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash:         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 4, 2022, 8:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

removes<!----></span><br>it as an observer via deregistering it from SidePanelRegistry.<span class="line"><!---->it as an observer via deregistering it from           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1349795#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 4, 2022, 8:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>TopChrome>SidePanel
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          abigailbklein@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtseng@chromium.org mschillaci@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Critical Security_Impact-None FoundIn-106 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;SidePanel
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<span class="line"><!---->The underlying bug seems to be that ReadAnythingCoordinator has a ScopedObservation on a SidePanelEntry, and therefore tried to call SidePanelEntry::RemoveObserver during destruction. ReadAnythingCoordinator is a BrowserUserData and SidePanelEntry is owned by SidePanelRegistry which itself is a SupportsUserData::Data keyed off of a WebContents. So I don't think either one is expected to outlive the other.<!----></span><br><br>Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<span class="line"><!---->Reproduces on macOS 1030371 (106). You don't actually need to run the PoC, closing any window seems to suffice.<!----></span><br><br>I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <span class="line"><!---->I cannot repro on Linux, but I suspect that's simply accidental timing, so the bug might be apply to more than just macOS  and I'm conservatively checking all the OS boxes. <!----></span><br><br>Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Security_Severity-Critical for being a browser process UAF, but also Security_Impact-None because as far as I can tell ReadAnything has not been enabled anywhere by default.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
